ArticleTitle.sentence: Monomer-dimer control of the ColE1 P(cer) promoter.

AbstractText.sentence: XerCD-mediated recombination at cer converts multimers of plasmid ColE1 to monomers, maximizing the number of independently segregating molecules and minimizing the frequency of plasmid loss.
In addition to XerCD, recombination requires the accessory factors ArgR and PepA.
The promoter P(cer), located centrally within cer, is also required for stable plasmid maintenance.
